Directions: 0) In a large saucepan over medium high heat, combine the chicken meat, chicken broth, salt and pepper. 1) Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. 2) Cover and let simmer for 30 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear. 3) Remove the chicken and let cool. 4) Pour the remaining chicken broth mixture into a measuring cup. 5) Let stand; spoon off fat. 6) Add enough milk to the broth mixture to equal 2 1/2 cups. 7) Cut chicken into 1/2 inch pieces. 8) In the same pan, melt butter or margarine over medium heat. 9) Add the onion and celery. 10) Saute, stirring, for 3 minutes. 11) Stir in flour until well blended. 12) Gradually stir in broth mixture. 13) Simmer, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens and boils. 14) Add the chicken, vegetables, parsley and thyme. 15) Pour mixture into a 1 1/2 quart deep casserole dish. 16) Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). 17) Roll out pastry 1 inch larger than the diameter of the casserole dish on a lightly floured surface. 18) Cut slits in the pastry for venting air. 19) Place pastry on top of casserole. 20) Roll edges and cut away extra pastry; flute edges by pinching together. 21) Brush pastry with beaten egg and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbling. 22) Let cool for 10 minutes and serve.
Question: Ok. No problem. What are the next ingredients? 1 onion, chopped Ok. I have them. What is next? 1/3 cup all-purpose flour Could you repeat the last part?
llama_answers: Sure! The last ingredient listed was 1/3 cup all-purpose flour.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 3 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 3 apples - peeled, cored and sliced, 1 cup white sugar, 1 cup brown sugar, 1 1/4 cups vegetable oil, 2 eggs, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1 cup chopped walnuts, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan. 2) Sift together the flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt. 3) Combine the apples and the white sugar; set aside. 4) In a large bowl, mix together the brown sugar, oil, eggs and vanilla. 5) Stir in the apple mixture, then the flour mixture. 6) Fold in the walnuts. 7) Pour batter into prepared pan. 8) Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. 9) Allow to cool.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 cups pineapple juice, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, 2 tablespoons light soy sauce (50% less sodium), 1 1/2 tablespoons white vinegar, 2 garlic cloves, crushed, 3 tablespoons minced fresh ginger, 1 1/4 pounds raw firm fish, such as salmon, tuna or halibut, cut in chunks, 4 cups fresh pineapple in large chunks (or substitute canned pineapple chunks), 1 large red onion, cut in wedges, 
Directions: 0) In a small saucepan, dissolve cornstarch in pineapple juice. 1) Add soy sauce, vinegar, garlic and ginger. 2) Simmer until slightly thickened, about 7 minutes. 3) Let cool. 4) Add fish and pineapple to sauce and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. 5) Thread fish, pineapple and onion on skewers. 6) Place on a hot grill (or under a broiler) until fish is done to your liking. 7) Serve with rice.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 6 pounds tart apples, cored and sliced, 6 cups apple cider, 3 cups white sugar, 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon, 1 teaspoon ground cloves, 
Directions: 0) Place the apples in a Dutch oven. 1) Pour in the cider. 2) Bring to a boil and cook on medium heat 30 minutes, or until soft. 3) Press the softened mixture through a food mill. 4) Continue cooking at a medium boil for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. 5) Mix in the sugar, cinnamon and cloves. 6) Continue cooking over low heat until the sugar dissolves, stirring frequently. 7) Cook until the desired thickness has been attained. 8) Refrigerate the finished apple butter in sterile containers.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 (3 1/2) pound broiler-fryer chicken, cut up, 1 pound new potatoes, cut into chunks, 2 tablespoons cooking oil, 1 cup half-and-half cream, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon seasoned pepper, 3/4 cup sliced green onions, 1/4 cup chopped fresh dill weed, 1/2 cup sour cream, 
Directions: 0) In a large skillet over medium heat, brown chicken and potatoes in oil for 10-15 minutes. 1) Remove chicken and potatoes; set aside. 2) Discard all but 1 tablespoon drippings. 3) To drippings, add cream, salt and pepper; stir to mix. 4) Return chicken and potatoes to skillet. 5) Sprinkle with onions and dill. 6) Cover and simmer for 50-60 minutes or until chicken juices run clear and potatoes are tender. 7) With a slotted spoon, remove chicken and potatoes to a serving platter; keep warm. 8) Add sour cream to pan; stir to mix and heat through. 9) Serve with chicken and potatoes.

Directions: 0) In a large skillet or deep fryer, fry chicken wings in oil until done, about 10 minutes. 1) Remove chicken and oil from skillet, drain oil and reserve chicken. 2) Melt butter in skillet, then add vinegar and hot sauce. 3) Season with salt and pepper to taste. 4) Add cooked chicken to sauce and stir over low heat to coat. 5) The longer the wings simmer in the sauce, the hotter they will be. 6) Serve warm.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 (3 pound) whole chicken, cut into 8 pieces, 1/2 cup soy sauce, 3/4 cup distilled white vinegar, 1 bulb garlic, peeled and crushed, 2 tablespoons thinly sliced fresh ginger root, 2 bay leaves, 1/2 tablespoon black peppercorns, 
Directions: 0) Combine the chicken, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, ginger, bay leaves and peppercorns in a Dutch oven. 1) Bring to a boil over medium heat. 2) Once it boils, reduce heat to a simmer. 3) Cover the pot and simmer for 30 minutes, basting the chicken occasionally. 4) After 30 minutes, remove lid and cook until liquid has reduced to half. 5) Remove chicken from the pot to a serving plate. 6) Strain the liquid from the pot to remove all the food particles, and set aside. 7) Serve chicken hot over steamed rice and drizzle with reserved sauce.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1/4 cup butter, 1/2 bunch green onions, chopped, 1/2 cup butter, 2 pounds frozen crawfish, cleaned, 2 (10.75 ounce) cans condensed cream of potato soup, 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup, 1 (15.25 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained, 4 ounces cream cheese, softened, 2 cups half-and-half cream, 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper,

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1/4 cup cold margarine, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 (8 ounce) package light cream cheese, softened, 2 tablespoons heat-stable granular sugar substitute, 1 (8 ounce) container reduced-fat frozen whipped topping, thawed, divided, 1 1/2 cups cold skim milk, 1 (1.4 ounce) package instant  sugar-free chocolate pudding mix, 
Directions: 0) In a bowl, cut margarine into flour until crumbly. 1) Press into an 11-in baking dish coated with nonstick cooking spray. 2) Bake at 350 degrees F for 15-18 minutes or until lightly browned. 3) Cool completely. 4) In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and sweetener until smooth. 5) Fold in half of the whipped topping. 6) Carefully spread over the crust. 7) In a mixing bowl, combine milk and pudding mix. 8) Beat on low speed for 2 minutes. 9) Let stand for 2-3 minutes. 10) Spread over the cream cheese. 11) Top with the remaining whipped topping.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon light brown sugar, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/8 teaspoon salt, 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, 1 1/2 tablespoons ice water, 1 cup skim milk, 3 egg whites, 2 tablespoons white sugar, 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 bananas, peeled and sliced, 1 kiwi, peeled and sliced, 1 cup sliced fresh strawberries, 
Directions: 0) In a bowl, sift together the flour, light brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt. 1) Cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. 2) Sprinkle with the ice water, and toss the mixture with a fork until evenly moistened. 3) Pat into a round, and wrap in plastic. 4) Refrigerate for 30 minutes. 5) In the top half of a double boiler, heat the milk until it begins to bubble. 6) In a bowl, beat together the egg whites, sugar, and 1 tablespoon of the hot milk. 7) Whisk the egg white mixture into the remaining hot milk. 8) Cook and stir without boiling about 10 minutes, until the mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a metal spoon. 9) Remove from heat, and stir in the vanilla. 10) Cool to room temperature. 11) Preheat oven to 375  degrees F (190 degrees C). 12) Lightly grease an 8 inch tart pan with a removable bottom. 13) On a floured surface, roll the tart dough out to 1/4 inch thickness. 14) Press the chilled dough into the prepared tart pan. 15) Trim the edges, and pierce the bottom with a fork. 16) Bake 15 to 18 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden brown. 17) Remove to a wire rack, and cool completely. 18) Spoon the filling mixture into the crust. 19) Bake 18 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven. 20) Cool to room temperature on a wire rack. 21) Refrigerate 8 hours.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon light brown sugar, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/8 teaspoon salt, 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, 1 1/2 tablespoons ice water, 1 cup skim milk, 3 egg whites, 2 tablespoons white sugar, 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 bananas, peeled and sliced, 1 kiwi, peeled and sliced, 1 cup sliced fresh strawberries, 
Directions: 0) In a bowl, sift together the flour, light brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt. 1) Cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. 2) Sprinkle with the ice water, and toss the mixture with a fork until evenly moistened. 3) Pat into a round, and wrap in plastic. 4) Refrigerate for 30 minutes. 5) In the top half of a double boiler, heat the milk until it begins to bubble. 6) In a bowl, beat together the egg whites, sugar, and 1 tablespoon of the hot milk. 7) Whisk the egg white mixture into the remaining hot milk. 8) Cook and stir without boiling about 10 minutes, until the mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a metal spoon. 9) Remove from heat, and stir in the vanilla. 10) Cool to room temperature. 11) Preheat oven to 375  degrees F (190 degrees C). 12) Lightly grease an 8 inch tart pan with a removable bottom. 13) On a floured surface, roll the tart dough out to 1/4 inch thickness. 14) Press the chilled dough into the prepared tart pan. 15) Trim the edges, and pierce the bottom with a fork. 16) Bake 15 to 18 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden brown. 17) Remove to a wire rack, and cool completely. 18) Spoon the filling mixture into the crust. 19) Bake 18 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven. 20) Cool to room temperature on a wire rack. 21) Refrigerate 8 hours.
Question: Ok, good, I have them, which are the next two ingredients? 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon Ok, good, could you tell me the other ingredients? 1 1/2 tablespoons ice water Good, could I use Allmond milk instead?
llama_answers: Yes, you can use almond milk instead of skim milk.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons peanut oil, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger, 1 bunch green onions, chopped, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into strips, 2 onions, thinly sliced, 1 cup sliced cabbage, 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced, 2 cups sugar snap peas, 1 cup chicken broth, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 2 tablespoons white sugar, 2 tablespoons cornstarch, 
Directions: 0) Heat peanut oil in a wok or large skillet. 1) When oil begins to smoke, quickly stir in 2 cloves minced garlic, ginger root, green onions and salt. 2) Stir fry until onion becomes translucent, about 2 minutes. 3) Add chicken and stir until opaque, about 3 minutes. 4) Add sweet onions, cabbage, bell pepper, peas and 1/2 cup of the broth/water and cover. 5) In a small bowl, mix the remaining 1/2 cup broth/water, soy sauce, sugar and cornstarch. 6) Add sauce mixture to wok/skillet and stir until chicken and vegetables are coated with the thickened sauce. 7) Serve immediately, over hot rice if desired.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 cup semisweet chocolate chips, 1/2 cup butter, softened, 1/2 cup white sugar, 1/2 cup packed brown sugar, 2 eggs, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 
Directions: 0) Melt the chocolate chips in a heavy saucepan over very low heat. 1) Stir to evenly melt. 2) Cream together the butter and sugars until light. 3) Beat in the eggs, one at a time. 4) Stir in the melted chocolate and vanilla. 5) In a bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder and baking soda. 6) Add to the butter mixture slowly. 7) Blend thoroughly. 8) Shape into 1-inch balls and place on a greased cookie sheet. 9) Bake at 350 degrees F (180 degrees C) for 12 to 14 minutes. 10) Let sit on cookie sheet for a minute or two before removing to a rack to cool.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 eggplant, seeded and cut lengthwise into 1/4 inch slices, 1 red bell pepper, sliced into thin strips, salt and pepper to taste, 1 French baguette, 2 ounces soft goat cheese, 1/4 cup tapenade (olive spread), 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 
Directions: 0) Preheat the oven broiler. 1) Place the eggplant and red bell pepper on a medium baking sheet, and season with salt and pepper. 2) Broil 5 to 10 minutes, until tender and slightly browned. 3) Cut baguette in half lengthwise. 4) Spread bottom half with goat cheese, followed by tapenade. 5) Layer with eggplant and red pepper, then sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. 6) Cover with top half of baguette. 7) Cut into 4 pieces. 8) Serve hot or cold.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 cups chopped, cooked chicken meat, 2 cups fresh chopped broccoli, 1/2 cup chopped onion, 1/2 cup chopped green bell pepper, 1 1/2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese, 1/2 cup mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons Dijon-style prepared mustard, salt and pepper to taste, 1 tablespoon minced garlic, 1 (8 ounce) package refrigerated crescent rolls, 
Directions: 0) In a large bowl, combine the chicken, broccoli, onions, bell pepper, cheese, mayonnaise, mustard, salt, pepper and garlic. 1) Mix all together. 2) Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). 3) Cover a cookie sheet with aluminum foil. 4) Place a glass upside down in the center of the cookie sheet. 5) Roll out crescent rolls around the base of the glass, with pointy ends away from the glass; when you're finished, the arrangement will look like the sun. 6) Spoon some of the chicken mixture onto the thick part of each crescent roll. 7) Fold the pointy end of each roll over the top of the mixture and tuck in the middle. 8) Remove glass from cookie sheet. 9) Arrangement of rolls will now look like a fluted tube cake. 10) Bake in preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes, or until rolls are golden brown.

Directions: 0) In a large bowl, combine the chicken, broccoli, onions, bell pepper, cheese, mayonnaise, mustard, salt, pepper and garlic. 1) Mix all together. 2) Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). 3) Cover a cookie sheet with aluminum foil. 4) Place a glass upside down in the center of the cookie sheet. 5) Roll out crescent rolls around the base of the glass, with pointy ends away from the glass; when you're finished, the arrangement will look like the sun. 6) Spoon some of the chicken mixture onto the thick part of each crescent roll. 7) Fold the pointy end of each roll over the top of the mixture and tuck in the middle. 8) Remove glass from cookie sheet. 9) Arrangement of rolls will now look like a fluted tube cake. 10) Bake in preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes, or until rolls are golden brown.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 8 lasagna noodles, uncooked, 1 cup shredded reduced-fat Monterey Jack cheese, 1 (15 ounce) container part-skim ricotta cheese, 1 (4.5 ounce) can chopped green chiles, drained, 1/2 teaspoon chili powder, 1/8 teaspoon salt, 2 cups drained canned no-salt-added black beans, Cooking spray, 1 (15.5 ounce) jar no-salt-added salsa, Fresh cilantro sprigs (optional), 
Directions: 0) Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions, omitting salt and fat; drain well. 1) Combine cheeses and next 3 ingredients, stirring well. 2) Spread cheese mixture over one side of each noodle. 3) Spoon black beans evenly over cheese mixture. 4) Roll up noodles, jellyroll fashion, beginning at narrow ends. 5) Place lasagna rolls, seam sides down, in an 11- x 7- x 11/2-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. 6) Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until thoroughly heated. 7) To serve, spoon salsa evenly over rolls, and garnish with cilantro sprigs, if desired.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds new potatoes, cut into wedges, 4 tablespoons butter, 2 teaspoons fresh rosemary, salt and pepper to taste, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). 1) In a hot skillet, melt the butter. 2) Stir in rosemary, salt and pepper. 3) Coat potatoes evenly with the melted butter. 4) Arrange the potatoes in a single layer on a baking pan. 5) Bake in a preheated oven until potatoes are golden brown, approximately 20 to 25 minutes. 6) Toss them occasionally to ensure that they brown on all sides.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 40 rectangular shortbread cookies, 35 individually wrapped caramels, unwrapped, 1/4 cup water, 4 cups milk chocolate chips, 
Directions: 0) Place shortbread cookies on a baking sheet or tray. 1) In a small saucepan over medium-low heat, melt caramels in water, stirring frequently. 2) Spoon a thin line of caramel over each cookie. 3) Place cookies in refrigerator until caramel is set. 4) Line baking sheets or trays with waxed paper. 5) In a double boiler over simmering water, melt chocolate. 6) Dip cookies in chocolate one at a time, tapping against the side of the bowl to remove excess. 7) Place on prepared sheets and let rest at room temperature several hours, until set.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 cup rye flour, 3/4 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 cup sugar, 2 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon caraway seeds, 3/4 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, 1 egg, beaten, 3/4 cup milk, 1/3 cup vegetable oil, 
Directions: 0) In a large bowl, combine the flours, sugar, baking powder, salt and caraway seeds. 1) Stir in cheese. 2) Combine the egg, milk and oil; stir into the dry ingredients just until moistened. 3) Fill greased or paper-lined muffin cups two-thirds full. 4) Bake at 400 degrees F for 20-23 minutes or a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. 5) Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack. 6) Serve warm.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 (8 pound) bone-in shank ham, 4 cups water, or as needed, 1/2 cup honey, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 2 tablespoons liquid smoke flavoring, 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce, 1 pinch ground cloves, 
Directions: 0) Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C). 1) Place ham in a roasting pan. 2) Pour in water to a 2 inch depth. 3) Cover with a tight fitting lid. 4) Bake for 6 to 8 hours in the preheated oven (all day or all night). 5) Remove from the oven, pour off drippings and reserve. 6) Debone ham, removing any excess fat as well, and return to the roasting pan. 7) Skim fat from the top of the drippings, and discard. 8) In a small bowl, mix one cup of the drippings with honey, brown sugar, liquid smoke, Worcestershire sauce and cloves. 9) Pour this over the ham, cover and return to the oven. 10) Remaining drippings may be discarded or reserved for other uses. 11) Bake for another 30 to 40 minutes in the preheated oven. 12) Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, 1 (1.27 ounce) packet dry fajita seasoning, divided, 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained, 1 (11 ounce) can Mexican-style corn, 1/2 cup salsa, 1 (10 ounce) package mixed salad greens, 1 onion, chopped, 1 tomato, cut into wedges, 
Directions: 0) Rub chicken evenly with 1/2 the fajita seasoning. 1) Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat, and cook the chicken 8 minutes on each side, or until juices run clear; set aside. 2) In a large saucepan, mix beans, corn, salsa and other 1/2 of fajita seasoning. 3) Heat over medium heat until warm. 4) Prepare the salad by tossing the greens, onion and tomato. 5) Top salad with chicken and dress with the bean and corn mixture.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 16 cups popped popcorn, 1 cup roasted peanuts, 1 cup brown sugar, 1/2 cup butter, 1/4 cup light corn syrup, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1 cup milk chocolate chips, 1 teaspoon shortening, 
Directions: 0) Grease cookie sheets. 1) Place popcorn and peanuts in a paper bag. 2) Set aside. 3) In a microwave safe bowl, combine sugar, butter, corn syrup, vanilla and salt. 4) Microwave 4 minutes, until bubbly. 5) Stir in baking soda. 6) Pour over popcorn mixture and shake bag to coat. 7) Roll down edges of bag and place bag in microwave. 8) Heat for 2 minutes, shaking three times to mix. 9) Spread mixture onto prepared sheets to cool. 10) In a microwave safe bowl, combine chocolate and shortening. 11) Microwave 90 seconds, stirring once, until melted. 12) Drizzle over popcorn mixture. 13) Let cool before serving.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1/2 cup butter, 1 cup water, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 4 eggs, 1 (5 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix, 2 1/2 cups cold milk, 1 cup heavy cream, 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 (1 ounce) squares semisweet chocolate, 2 tablespoons butter, 1 cup confectioners' sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 3 tablespoons hot water, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). 1) Grease a cookie sheet. 2) In a medium saucepan, combine 1/2 cup butter and 1 cup water. 3) Bring to a boil, stirring until butter melts completely. 4) Reduce heat to low, and add flour and salt. 5) Stir vigorously until mixture leaves the sides of the pan and begins to form a stiff ball. 6) Remove from heat. 7) Add eggs, one at a time, beating well to incorporate completely after each addition. 8) With a spoon or a pastry bag fitted with a No. 10, or larger, tip, spoon or pipe dough onto cookie sheet in 1 1/2 x 4 inch strips. 9) Bake 15 minutes in the preheated oven, then reduce heat to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) and bake 20 minutes more, until hollow sounding when lightly tapped on the bottom. 10) Cool completely on a wire rack. 11) For the filling, combine pudding mix and milk in medium bowl according to package directions. 12) In a separate bowl, beat the cream with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. 13) Beat in 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. 14) Fold whipped cream into pudding. 15) Cut tops off of cooled pastry shells with a sharp knife. 16) Fill shells with pudding mixture and replace tops. 17) For the icing, melt the chocolate and 2 tablespoons butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. 18) Stir in 1 cup confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. 19) Stir in hot water, one tablespoon at a time, until icing is smooth and has reached desired consistency. 20) Remove from heat, cool slightly, and drizzle over filled eclairs. 21) Refrigerate until serving.
Question: Yes I'd like that! 1/2 cup butter Ok good! They are ready. What next?
llama_answers: Next, you can fill the eclairs with the pudding mixture and replace the tops.

Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). 1) Grease a cookie sheet. 2) In a medium saucepan, combine 1/2 cup butter and 1 cup water. 3) Bring to a boil, stirring until butter melts completely. 4) Reduce heat to low, and add flour and salt. 5) Stir vigorously until mixture leaves the sides of the pan and begins to form a stiff ball. 6) Remove from heat. 7) Add eggs, one at a time, beating well to incorporate completely after each addition. 8) With a spoon or a pastry bag fitted with a No. 10, or larger, tip, spoon or pipe dough onto cookie sheet in 1 1/2 x 4 inch strips. 9) Bake 15 minutes in the preheated oven, then reduce heat to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) and bake 20 minutes more, until hollow sounding when lightly tapped on the bottom. 10) Cool completely on a wire rack. 11) For the filling, combine pudding mix and milk in medium bowl according to package directions. 12) In a separate bowl, beat the cream with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. 13) Beat in 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. 14) Fold whipped cream into pudding. 15) Cut tops off of cooled pastry shells with a sharp knife. 16) Fill shells with pudding mixture and replace tops. 17) For the icing, melt the chocolate and 2 tablespoons butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. 18) Stir in 1 cup confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. 19) Stir in hot water, one tablespoon at a time, until icing is smooth and has reached desired consistency. 20) Remove from heat, cool slightly, and drizzle over filled eclairs. 21) Refrigerate until serving.
Question: Ok, can I use brown sugar? 2 1/2 cups cold milk Ok no problem, could you give me more ingredients? 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Ok good. What next?
llama_answers: You can proceed with the recipe as usual.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, 1 onion, chopped, 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained, 5 eggs, beaten, 3 cups shredded Muenster cheese, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon ground black pepper, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Lightly grease a 9 inch pie pan. 2) Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. 3) Add onions and cook, stirring occasionally, until onions are soft. 4) Stir in spinach and continue cooking until excess moisture has evaporated. 5) In a large bowl, combine eggs, cheese, salt and pepper. 6) Add spinach mixture and stir to blend. 7) Scoop into prepared pie pan. 8) Bake in preheated oven until eggs have set, about 30 minutes. 9) Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups dried black-eyed peas, soaked overnight, 1/3 cup chopped celery, with leaves, 1 1/2 cups shredded carrot, 3/4 cup chopped fresh parsley, 1/2 cup chopped white onion, 1/8 cup chopped fresh mint, 1/4 cup olive oil, 2 oranges, juiced, 1/2 lemon, juiced, 1 garlic clove, pressed, 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1 teaspoon brown sugar, 
Directions: 0) Place the beans in a saucepan with enough water to cover them by one inch. 1) Bring beans to a slow boil. 2) Reduce heat to low, and simmer until tender but not mushy (about 35 minutes). 3) Set aside to cool. 4) When the beans have cooled, place them in a large bowl. 5) Add the celery, carrots, parsley, white onion, and mint; toss to blend. 6) For dressing, blend olive oil, orange and lemon juice, garlic, coriander, salt, pepper, and brown sugar in a blender for 6 seconds. 7) Transfer to a small saucepan, and simmer over low heat for five minutes. 8) Remove from heat, and cool. 9) Pour dressing over the bean salad, and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

Directions: 0) Place the beans in a saucepan with enough water to cover them by one inch. 1) Bring beans to a slow boil. 2) Reduce heat to low, and simmer until tender but not mushy (about 35 minutes). 3) Set aside to cool. 4) When the beans have cooled, place them in a large bowl. 5) Add the celery, carrots, parsley, white onion, and mint; toss to blend. 6) For dressing, blend olive oil, orange and lemon juice, garlic, coriander, salt, pepper, and brown sugar in a blender for 6 seconds. 7) Transfer to a small saucepan, and simmer over low heat for five minutes. 8) Remove from heat, and cool. 9) Pour dressing over the bean salad, and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1/2 cup teriyaki sauce, 1 cup oyster sauce, 1/4 cup soy sauce, 1/4 cup ketchup, 2 tablespoons garlic powder, 1/4 cup gin, 2 dashes liquid smoke flavoring, 1/2 cup white sugar, 1 1/2 pounds chicken wings, separated at joints, tips discarded, 1/4 cup honey, 
Directions: 0) In a large bowl, mix the teriyaki sauce, oyster sauce, soy sauce, ketchup, garlic powder, gin, liquid smoke, and sugar. 1) Place the chicken wings in the bowl, cover, and marinate in the refrigerator 8 hours or overnight. 2) Preheat the grill for low heat. 3) Lightly oil the grill grate. 4) Arrange chicken on the grill, and discard the marinade. 5) Grill the chicken wings on one side for 20 minutes, then turn and brush with honey. 6) Continue grilling 25 minutes, or until juices run clear.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 medium cooking apples, peeled, cored, and chopped, 2/3 cup fresh or frozen blueberries, 1 tablespoon heat-stable granular sugar substitute, 1/2 teaspoon apple pie spice or ground allspice, 1 1/3 cups whole wheat pastry flour, 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil, 3 tablespoons low-fat milk, 
Directions: 0) In a medium bowl combine apples, blueberries, sugar substitute, and the 1/4 teaspoon apple pie spice; set aside. 1) In another medium bowl stir together whole wheat pastry flour, kosher salt, and the 1/8 teaspoon apple pie spice. 2) Add oil and milk all at once to flour mixture. 3) Stir lightly with a fork until dough comes together. 4) Divide dough into 6 portions. 5) Using six 3 1/2- to 4-inch individual tart pans with removable bottoms, press one dough portion on the bottom and up the side of each tart pan. 6) Divide fruit mixture among pastry-lined pans. 7) Place tart pans on a large baking sheet. 8) Place a large piece of foil over tart pans; press down lightly around the edges to seal. 9) Bake in a 375 degrees F oven for 20 minutes; remove foil. 10) Bake about 20 minutes more or until fruit is tender. 11) Let cool in tart pans on a wire rack for 15 minutes. 12) Carefully remove sides of tart pans. 13) Serve warm or cool.

Directions: 0) In a medium bowl combine apples, blueberries, sugar substitute, and the 1/4 teaspoon apple pie spice; set aside. 1) In another medium bowl stir together whole wheat pastry flour, kosher salt, and the 1/8 teaspoon apple pie spice. 2) Add oil and milk all at once to flour mixture. 3) Stir lightly with a fork until dough comes together. 4) Divide dough into 6 portions. 5) Using six 3 1/2- to 4-inch individual tart pans with removable bottoms, press one dough portion on the bottom and up the side of each tart pan. 6) Divide fruit mixture among pastry-lined pans. 7) Place tart pans on a large baking sheet. 8) Place a large piece of foil over tart pans; press down lightly around the edges to seal. 9) Bake in a 375 degrees F oven for 20 minutes; remove foil. 10) Bake about 20 minutes more or until fruit is tender. 11) Let cool in tart pans on a wire rack for 15 minutes. 12) Carefully remove sides of tart pans. 13) Serve warm or cool.
Question: Yay! Sounds delicious. Can you give me the ingredients first? 2 medium cooking apples, peeled, cored, and chopped Ok. I did that! More ingredients? 2/3 cup fresh or frozen blueberries Ok. Good! Can I use sugar instead of sugar substitute?
llama_answers: Yes, you can use sugar instead of sugar substitute.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 3 pounds beef roast, 2 onions, chopped, 2 (12 fluid ounce) cans or bottles beer, 6 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce, 2 teaspoons liquid smoke flavoring, 2 teaspoons garlic powder, 2 teaspoons ground black pepper, salt to taste, 1 (18 ounce) bottle barbecue sauce, 2 cups water, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C). 1) Place roast in a large roasting pan and scatter chopped onions over. 2) In a large bowl, combine Worcestershire sauce, liquid smoke, garlic powder, salt and pepper. 3) Pour in beer, stir and add to roasting pan. 4) Add water to the top of beef. 5) Cover and cook in oven at 275 degrees F (135 degrees C) for 4 to 5 hours. 6) When meat is cooked, shred meat with 2 forks, add barbecue sauce and mix well.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 6 Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and cubed, 2 sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed, 2 tablespoons butter, 1/2 cup heavy cream, 1 tablespoon chicken bouillon granules, 1 2/3 tablespoons brown sugar, 2 teaspoons black pepper, 2 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, 
Directions: 0) Place the potatoes and sweet potatoes in a large pot with enough water to cover. 1) Bring to a boil. 2) Remove from heat, and drain. 3) Preheat the oven broiler. 4) In a large bowl, mash the potatoes. 5) Gradually mix in butter, heavy cream, chicken bouillon, brown sugar, and pepper. 6) Transfer the mixture to a medium baking dish, and top with Monterey Jack cheese. 7) Broil uncovered in the preheated oven 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and lightly browned.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 (9 inch) deep dish frozen pie crust, 4 eggs, 1 cup heavy cream, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, 3 dashes hot pepper sauce (e.g. Tabasco), or to taste, 1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese, 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 1 (8 ounce) package imitation crabmeat, flaked, 1 green onion, chopped, 
Directions: 0) Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Bake the pie crust for about 10 minutes, until just starting to brown. 2) Remove from the oven, and allow to cool. 3) In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, cream, salt, pepper, and hot sauce. 4) Stir in shredded cheese, onion and imitation crab. 5) Pour into the pie shell. 6) Bake for 25 to 30 minutes in the preheated oven, then turn off the oven, but leave the door closed. 7) Leave quiche in the oven for an additional 20 to 30 minutes until firm.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 6 center cut pork chops, trimmed of any visible fat, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/2 teaspoon seasoning salt, 1 egg, beaten with, 1/4 cup egg substitute, 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, 2 cups Italian-style seasoned bread crumbs, 2 tablespoons olive oil, canola cooking spray, 1 (10.75 ounce) can  reduced fat condensed cream of mushroom soup, 1/2 cup 1% low-fat milk, 1/3 cup white wine, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Rinse pork chops, pat dry, and season with garlic powder and seasoning salt to taste. 2) Place the beaten egg and egg substitute mixture in a small bowl. 3) Dredge the pork chops lightly in flour, dip in the egg, and coat liberally with bread crumbs. 4) Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. 5) Place the pork chops in the pan and coat the tops with canola cooking spray. 6) Fry the pork chops 5 minutes per side, or until the breading appears well browned. 7) Transfer the chops to a 9x13 inch baking dish, and cover with foil. 8) Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour. 9) While baking, combine the cream of mushroom soup, milk, and white wine in a medium bowl. 10) After the pork chops have baked for an hour, cover them with the soup mixture. 11) Replace foil, and bake for another 30 minutes.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 cup warm water (110 degrees F), 1 egg, 3 cups bread flour, 1/4 cup white sugar, 3 tablespoons instant powdered milk, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, 5 tablespoons butter, softened, 1 teaspoon instant yeast, 1/3 cup butter, 1/2 cup vanilla ice cream, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/2 cup butter, softened (for spreading), 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 
Directions: 0) Place water, egg, bread flour, white sugar, powdered milk, salt, 5 tablespoons butter and yeast in bread machine in the order suggested by the manufacturer. 1) Select DOUGH setting, and turn machine on. 2) Meanwhile; in a small saucepan, melt 1/3 cup butter. 3) Add 1/2 cup brown sugar and ice cream; bring to a boil, and cook for 2 minutes. 4) Pour caramel into the bottom of a lightly greased 9 x 13 inch pan. 5) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 6) When machine has finished cycling remove dough from pan and turn it out onto a lightly floured surface. 7) Pat dough into a rectangle. 8) Spread with softened butter and sprinkle lightly with cinnamon. 9) Crumble 1/2 cup brown sugar over the top. 10) Roll up, and seal edge. 11) Cut into 12 rolls, and place in prepared pan of caramel. 12) Allow to rise until doubled in size, about 45 minutes. 13) Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for approximately 20 to 25 minutes, until golden brown.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 cup warm water (110 degrees F), 1 egg, 3 cups bread flour, 1/4 cup white sugar, 3 tablespoons instant powdered milk, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, 5 tablespoons butter, softened, 1 teaspoon instant yeast, 1/3 cup butter, 1/2 cup vanilla ice cream, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/2 cup butter, softened (for spreading), 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 
Directions: 0) Place water, egg, bread flour, white sugar, powdered milk, salt, 5 tablespoons butter and yeast in bread machine in the order suggested by the manufacturer. 1) Select DOUGH setting, and turn machine on. 2) Meanwhile; in a small saucepan, melt 1/3 cup butter. 3) Add 1/2 cup brown sugar and ice cream; bring to a boil, and cook for 2 minutes. 4) Pour caramel into the bottom of a lightly greased 9 x 13 inch pan. 5) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 6) When machine has finished cycling remove dough from pan and turn it out onto a lightly floured surface. 7) Pat dough into a rectangle. 8) Spread with softened butter and sprinkle lightly with cinnamon. 9) Crumble 1/2 cup brown sugar over the top. 10) Roll up, and seal edge. 11) Cut into 12 rolls, and place in prepared pan of caramel. 12) Allow to rise until doubled in size, about 45 minutes. 13) Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for approximately 20 to 25 minutes, until golden brown.
Question: Ok no problem. Can I have the next two ingredients? 3 tablespoons instant powdered milk Ok. I've prepared them, what next? 5 tablespoons butter, softened Ok. I've got them. Which ingredients should I prepare next?
llama_answers: You need to prepare 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1/2 cup butter, softened.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 (1 pound) loaf French bread, cut diagonally in 1 inch slices, 8 eggs, 2 cups milk, 1 1/2 cups half-and-half cream, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 3/4 cup butter, 1 1/3 cups brown sugar, 3 tablespoons light corn syrup, 
Directions: 0) Butter a 9x13 inch baking dish. 1) Arrange the slices of bread in the bottom. 2) In a large bowl, beat together eggs, milk, cream, vanilla and cinnamon. 3) Pour over bread slices, cover, and refrigerate overnight. 4) The next morning, preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 5) In a small saucepan, combine butter, brown sugar and corn syrup; heat until bubbling. 6) Pour over bread and egg mixture. 7) Bake in preheated oven, uncovered, for 40 minutes.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1/2 cup butter, softened, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 3 bananas, mashed, 1/4 cup milk, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 eggs, 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup wheat bran, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/2 cup chopped walnuts, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). 1) Grease a muffin pan or line with paper muffin liners. 2) In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and brown sugar together until fluffy. 3) Add bananas, milk, vanilla and eggs; mix well. 4) Stir in flour, bran, baking powder, soda and salt; blend just until moistened. 5) Stir in walnuts. 6) Pour batter into prepared muffin cups. 7) Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean. 8) Cool in the cups for 5 minutes, then remove muffins and place on a wire rack to cool completely.
Question: Ok. The oven is preheated up. What to do now? 1) Grease a muffin pan or line with paper muffin liners. OK. Done. What is next? 2) In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and brown sugar together until fluffy. Sorry, I need to know the amount of cream and butter.
llama_answers: 1/2 cup butter, softened, and 1/2 cup brown sugar.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/2 cup packed brown sugar, 3 teaspoons baking powder, 1 teaspoon salt, 2 (4 ounce) jars apricot baby food, divided, 1 egg, 3/4 cup milk, 3 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 teaspoon almond extract, 2/3 cup sliced almonds, coarsely chopped, 1/2 cup diced dried apricots, 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar, 1 teaspoon milk, 1/8 teaspoon almond extract, 
Directions: 0) In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugars, baking powder and salt. 1) Set aside 1 tablespoon baby food for glaze. 2) In another bowl, beat the egg, milk, oil, extract and remaining baby food. 3) Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. 4) Fold in almonds and apricots. 5) Pour into a greased 9-in loaf pan. 6) Bake at 350 degrees F (180 degrees C) for 55-65 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. 7) Cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pan to a wire rack. 8) For glaze, combine the confectioners' sugar, milk, extract and reserved baby food until smooth. 9) Drizzle over cooled bread.
Question: Sounds nice! 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour Alright. I have them ready. What is next?
llama_answers: <no answer>

Directions: 0) In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugars, baking powder and salt. 1) Set aside 1 tablespoon baby food for glaze. 2) In another bowl, beat the egg, milk, oil, extract and remaining baby food. 3) Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. 4) Fold in almonds and apricots. 5) Pour into a greased 9-in loaf pan. 6) Bake at 350 degrees F (180 degrees C) for 55-65 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. 7) Cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pan to a wire rack. 8) For glaze, combine the confectioners' sugar, milk, extract and reserved baby food until smooth. 9) Drizzle over cooled bread.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 3/4 cup butter, divided, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided, 4 portobello mushroom caps, sliced, 1 clove garlic, chopped, 3/4 cup all-purpose flour, divided, 1 (14.5 ounce) can beef broth, 1/2 cup dry Marsala wine, kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste, 1 tablespoon browning sauce, 6 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - pounded to 1/2 inch thickness, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Melt 1/2 cup butter and heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. 2) Cook and stir the mushroom slices in the skillet until tender. 3) Remove from heat, cover to keep warm, and set aside. 4) Melt the remaining butter and heat the remaining oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. 5) Cook and stir the garlic until tender, then gradually whisk in the flour. 6) Increase heat to high, and pour in the beef broth and Marsala wine. 7) Season with kosher salt and pepper, and whisk in the browning sauce. 8) Bring to a boil, and reduce heat to low. 9) Mix in the mushrooms, reserving remaining butter and oil in the skillet. 10) Cover saucepan, remove from heat, and set aside. 11) Season chicken with salt and pepper, and dredge in the remaining flour. 12) Cook the chicken 2 minutes per side, until browned. 13) Arrange the chicken in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish, and cover with the sauce and mushroom mixture. 14) Cover baking dish, and bake 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until chicken juices run clear.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 6 large sourdough buns, 2 cups boneless chicken breast halves, cooked and diced, 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened, 1 cup shredded Pepper Jack cheese, 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 6 cloves garlic, pressed, 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Slice the top off of each bun, saving the tops. 2) Hollow out each bun, leaving a shell. 3) In a medium bowl combine chicken, cream cheese, Pepper Jack cheese, Parmesan cheese, garlic and spinach. 4) Spoon mixture into each bun, packing it tightly; cap with bun tops. 5) Wrap each bun tightly in foil. 6) Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 (5 pound) chuck roast, 1 cup barbeque sauce, 1 cup teriyaki sauce, 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer, 3 teaspoons minced garlic, 3 teaspoons thinly sliced fresh ginger root, 1 onion, finely chopped, 3 teaspoons coarsely ground black pepper, 2 teaspoons salt, 
Directions: 0) In a large bowl, mix barbeque sauce, teriyaki sauce, beer, garlic, ginger, onion, black pepper, and salt. 1) Place the roast into the marinade, cover and refrigerate for six hours, turning often. 2) Preheat an outdoor grill for indirect heat. 3) Remove the roast from the marinade, and pour the marinade into a saucepan. 4) Bring to a boil, and cook for 5 minutes. 5) Set aside for use as a basting sauce. 6) Thread the roast onto a rotating barbecue spit above indirect heat. 7) Cook the roast for two hours, or until the internal temperature of the roast is at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C). 8) Baste often during the last hour with reserved marinade.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil, 3 cups fresh chopped mushrooms, 2 green onions, chopped, 1 clove garlic, crushed, 1/2 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper, 4 ounces cream cheese, softened, 1 (6 ounce) can crabmeat, drained and flaked, 1 (17.5 ounce) package frozen puff pastry sheets, thawed, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). 1) Heat the olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. 2) Stir in the mushrooms, green onions, garlic and cayenne pepper. 3) Cook 10 minutes, or until tender. 4) Transfer the mushroom mixture to a medium bowl. 5) Blend in the cream cheese and crabmeat. 6) On a lightly floured flat surface, roll each pastry sheet into a 12x12 inch square. 7) Cut each sheet into nine 4x4 inch squares. 8) Place 1 tablespoon of the mushroom mixture onto each pastry square. 9) Fold the squares by bringing the corners to the center, creating an X. Place the squares on a medium baking sheet. 10) Bake 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 teaspoon olive oil, 1 cup diced zucchini, 1/2 cup minced onion, 1 clove garlic, peeled and minced, 2 cups diced fresh tomatoes, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, 4 (6 ounce) halibut steaks, 1/3 cup crumbled feta cheese, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Lightly grease a shallow baking dish. 1) Heat olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat and stir in zucchini, onion, and garlic. Cook and stir 5 minutes or until tender. 2) Remove saucepan from heat and mix in tomatoes, basil, salt, and pepper. 3) Arrange halibut steaks in a single layer in the prepared baking dish. 4) Spoon equal amounts of the zucchini mixture over each steak. 5) Top with feta cheese. 6) Bake 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until fish is easily flaked with a fork.

Directions: 0) Preheat a grill for high heat. 1) In a large bowl, mix together the Cheddar cheese, Parmesan cheese, onion, egg, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper. 2) Crumble in the ground beef, and mix together by hand. 3) Form into 6 patties, and wrap a slice of bacon around each one. 4) Secure bacon with toothpicks. 5) Place patties on the grill, and cook for 5 minutes per side, or until well done. 6) Remove toothpicks before serving on hamburger buns.

Ingredients: 1 cup all-purpose flour, 2 cups Italian-style seasoned bread crumbs, 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper, 2 eggs, beaten, 2 tablespoons water, 24 chicken tenderloins, 2 quarts oil for frying, 1 cup mayonnaise, 3 tablespoons prepared horseradish, 1/2 cup sour cream, 1 dash Worcestershire sauce, 3 tablespoons prepared mustard,

Ingredients: 1 cup all-purpose flour, 2 cups Italian-style seasoned bread crumbs, 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper, 2 eggs, beaten, 2 tablespoons water, 24 chicken tenderloins, 2 quarts oil for frying, 1 cup mayonnaise, 3 tablespoons prepared horseradish, 1/2 cup sour cream, 1 dash Worcestershire sauce, 3 tablespoons prepared mustard, 
Directions: 0) Place flour in a shallow bowl. 1) Place breadcrumbs in a separate shallow bowl, and mix with ground black pepper and cayenne pepper. 2) Place eggs and water in a small bowl. 3) One piece at a time, coat the chicken in the flour, the eggs and the bread crumbs, and set aside. 4) Heat oil in a deep fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). 5) In small batches, fry chicken 6 to 8 minutes, or until golden brown. 6) In a separate small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, horseradish, sour cream, Worcestershire sauce and mustard.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 medium head garlic, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 4 skinless, boneless chicken breasts, 1/2 cup white wine, 2 tablespoons butter, 1 cup milk, 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour, 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). 1) Slice the top of the head of garlic, just enough to remove paper and expose the tops of the cloves. 2) Drizzle with olive oil and roast in preheated oven, either in a clay garlic roaster or wrapped in aluminum foil. 3) Roast for 20 minutes or until cloves are soft and slip from skins when pushed. 4) Change oven setting to broil (375 degrees F, 190 degrees C). 5) Let garlic cool. 6) To prepare chicken, place in a 9x13 inch baking dish and splash both sides with white wine. 7) Broil for 25 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear. 8) Meanwhile, place butter or margarine and milk in a large skillet and heat over medium heat until warm. 9) Stir in the flour and cheese. 10) Stir over medium heat until sauce begins to thicken. 11) Slip cooled garlic cloves from skin and add to the sauce (if desired, mince first). 12) Add chopped parsley. 13) Bring nearly to a boil; reduce heat and stir to control thickening. 14) If desired, pour sauce over cooked rice or pasta and top with broiled chicken. 15) Enjoy!
Question: Ok yes please. 1 medium head garlic Ok I have those at home already. What is next?
llama_answers: Slice the top of the head of garlic, just enough to remove the paper and expose the tops of the cloves.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 cup packed brown sugar, 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg, 1/2 cup chopped pecans, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 cup butter, softened, 1 cup white sugar, 3/4 cup apple butter, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1/2 cup whole bran cereal or wheat germ, 1 cup sour cream, 2 eggs, beaten, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray or grease one 9x13 inch pan. 1) Prepare the topping by mixing together the brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg and chopped pecans. 2) Sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. 3) Blend together butter and sugar; add eggs and beat well; Add apple butter, vanilla, wheat germ or bran cereal; Add sifted dry ingredients alternately with sour cream; mix well after each addition. 4) Bake for 40 minutes. 5) Pour 1/2 batter into pan, sprinkle 1/2 the topping over top; Pour remaining batter and top with remaining topping.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 3 quarts peanut oil for frying, 2 tablespoons salt, 3 tablespoons coarse ground black pepper, 2 tablespoons cayenne pepper, 2 tablespoons garlic salt, 2 tablespoons onion salt, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 6 eggs, beaten, 6 pounds beef ribs, cut into single rib pieces, 
Directions: 0) Heat the oil in a deep-fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). 1) In a medium bowl, mix together the salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, garlic salt, and onion salt. 2) Place the flour in a separate bowl or plate. 3) Whisk eggs in a large bowl. 4) Rub the spice mixture onto all of the ribs. 5) Dip each rib in egg, then in flour, then egg, then flour again. 6) Place the ribs in a fryer basket so they are not crowded, try 4 or 5 at a time depending on the size of your fryer. 7) Cook for about 8 minutes.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 4 egg whites, 1 1/4 cups white sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 teaspoon lemon juice, 2 teaspoons cornstarch, 1 pint heavy cream, 6 kiwi, peeled and sliced, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). 1) Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. 2) Draw a 9 inch circle on the parchment paper. 3) In a large bowl, beat egg whites until stiff but not dry. 4) Gradually add in the sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, beating well after each addition. 5) Beat until thick and glossy. 6) Overbeaten egg whites lose volume and deflate when folded into other ingredients. 7) Be absolutely sure not a particle of grease or egg yolk gets into the whites. 8) Gently fold in vanilla extract, lemon juice and cornstarch. 9) Spoon mixture inside the circle drawn on the parchment paper. 10) Working from the center, spread mixture toward the outside edge, building edge slightly. 11) This should leave a slight depression in the center. 12) Bake for 1 hour. 13) Cool on a wire rack. 14) Remove the paper, and place meringue on a flat serving plate. 15) Fill the center of the meringue with whipped cream, sweetened if desired. 16) Top whipped cream with kiwifruit slices.
Question: Sounds good! I am ready! Are there many ingredients? Can I have the ingredients first?

Recipe:
Ingredients: 4 pounds boneless chuck roast, 2 cups water, 1 (1 ounce) package dry onion and mushroom soup mix, 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce, 3 potatoes, peeled and chopped, 2 stalks celery, chopped, 2 carrots, chopped, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Score roast on top and sides, and place in a medium sized oven bag. 2) Combine water, soup mix, and Worcestershire sauce; pour over roast. 3) Arrange vegetables around meat. 4) Place oven bag on a roasting pan. 5) Place roast in oven, and immediately reduce heat to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). 6) Bake for 1 1/2 hours for medium well done, or adjust time for desired doneness.

Ingredients: 6 (2 inch thick) slices French bread, 1/4 cup ricotta cheese, 1/4 cup cottage cheese, whipped, 2 tablespoons lowfat cream cheese, 2 teaspoons white sugar, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 3 cups egg substitute, 1/4 cup evaporated milk, 
Directions: 0) Cut a pocket in each slice of bread. 1) Open carefully 2) In a large bowl, combine the ricotta, cottage cheese and cream cheese. 3) Add the sugar and flavoring extract and beat until smooth. 4) Spread the mixture evenly into each bread pocket. 5) Beat together the egg substitutes and milk. 6) Dip the slices of bread in the egg mixture. 7) Heat a nonstick pan over medium-high heat. 8) Coat with cooking spray. 9) Cook the toast on each side for about 3 to 4 minutes per side until golden brown.

llama_answers: The next ingredients are ricotta cheese, cottage cheese, whipped cream cheese, sugar, vanilla extract, egg substitute, and evaporated milk.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 3 eggs, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 3/4 cup white sugar, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 3/4 cup light corn syrup, 1 cup chopped walnuts, 1/4 cup butter, 1 (9 inch) deep dish pie crust, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C). 1) Beat the eggs in a large bowl. 2) Mix in sugar, salt, vanilla, and syrup. 3) Melt the butter or margarine, and add it to the egg mixture. 4) Stir in the nuts. 5) Pour filling into pie shell. 6) Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes. 7) Reduce heat to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C), and continue baking for 35 to 45 minutes.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 (2 to 3 pound) whole chicken, cut into pieces, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 2 onions, chopped, 3 cloves garlic, crushed, 1/2 green bell pepper, chopped, 1/2 (15 ounce) can tomato sauce, 1 pinch saffron, salt to taste, 2 cubes  chicken bouillon, 1 1/2 cups uncooked white rice, 1 cup beer, 1 (15 ounce) can peas, drained, 1/2 red bell pepper, roasted and sliced, 
Directions: 0) Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. 1) Saute chicken until lightly browned; remove from skillet and set aside. 2) Saute onion, garlic and green bell pepper until soft; stir in tomato sauce, saffron, salt and bouillon and return chicken pieces to skillet. 3) Cook for 10 minutes, then add rice and reduce heat to low. 4) Add beer and simmer for 8 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until rice is tender. 5) Finally, stir in peas with liquid and garnish with roasted red bell pepper.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) package macaroni, 1/2 cup mayonnaise, 1 cup cucumber - peeled, seeded and chopped, 1 tablespoon dried minced onion, 1 cup diced ham, 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 3 tablespoons white wine vinegar, salt and pepper to taste, 
Directions: 0) In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook pasta until al dente, rinse under cold water and drain. 1) In a large bowl, combine the pasta, mayonnaise and mix well. 2) Stir in cucumber, onion, ham and cheese. 3) Mix well. 4) Drizzle oil and vinegar over top and toss. 5) Refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
Question: Hi. how do I make best macaroni salad?
llama_answers: To make the best macaroni salad, you should cook the pasta al dente, mix it with mayonnaise, cucumber, onion, ham, and cheese, and then refrigerate it for at least 4 hours. Additionally, you can drizzle oil and vinegar over the top and toss to add flavor.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) package baby carrots, sliced, 2 medium onions, sliced, 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, 3 tablespoons butter, 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 1 1/2 cups milk, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1 tablespoon butter, 1 cup fine dry bread crumbs, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Place carrots and onions in a pot with enough lightly salted water to cover, and bring to a boil. 2) Cook 5 minutes, or until tender but firm. 3) Drain, and spread 1/2 the carrots and onions in a baking dish. 4) Cover with 3/4 cup cheese, layer with remaining carrots and onions, and top with remaining cheese. 5) In a saucepan, melt 3 tablespoons butter and mix in flour until smooth. 6) Gradually stir in milk until thickened, and season with salt and pepper. 7) Pour over the carrots, onions, and cheese in the baking dish. 8) Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a small pot, and mix in bread crumbs. 9) Sprinkle evenly in the baking dish. 10) Bake 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until bubbly and lightly browned.
Question: Yes please! 1 (16 ounce) package baby carrots, sliced Ok, how big should the carrot package be?
llama_answers: 16 ounces.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 quarts water, 12 ounces beef shank, 2 large onions, chopped, 2 large carrots, sliced, 1 rutabaga, diced, salt and pepper to taste, 4 potatoes, peeled and quartered, 2 leeks, sliced, 1 small head cabbage, sliced, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley, 
Directions: 0) Bring water to boil in a large pot. 1) Place beef shank in, and simmer 1 1/2 hours. 2) Let cool overnight. 3) Lift meat out, trim off gristle and cut meat into medium sized pieces; set aside. 4) Skim fat from surface of stock, or strain through a fine sieve. 5) Return stock to heat, and bring to a boil. 6) Add onions, carrots and rutabaga. 7) Season with salt and pepper. 8) Simmer for 1 hour. 9) Add potatoes, and simmer until tender, 15 to 20 minutes. 10) Stir in the leeks, cabbage, parsley and reserved meat. 11) Simmer 10 minutes, or until cabbage is tender.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 (4 pound) chicken, cut into pieces, garlic powder to taste, 1/2 pound fresh mushrooms, sliced, 1 large onion, diced, 1/2 teaspoon dried basil, 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano, 1/2 teaspoon dried rosemary, 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme, 1 teaspoon garlic salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 1 teaspoon poultry seasoning, 1 cup dry white wine, 1 (10.5 ounce) can chicken broth, 
Directions: 0) Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. 1) Sprinkle chicken with garlic powder, and brown on both sides. 2) Remove chicken to paper towels. 3) Spoon off chicken fat, and return pan to stove. 4) Stir in mushrooms and onions; cook, stirring occasionally, until onions are soft. 5) Remove to a medium bowl. 6) In a separate bowl, mix together basil, oregano, rosemary, and thyme. 7) Season with garlic salt, pepper, and poultry seasoning. 8) Stir in wine, and add to onion and mushrooms. 9) Return chicken to Dutch oven. 10) Pour mushroom mixture and broth over chicken; cover, and cook over low heat until meat begins to fall off the bone, about 1 1/2 hours.
Question: Yes sounds good indeed. How should I start?
llama_answers: You can start by heating the olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 teaspoons baking soda, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1 teaspoon salt, 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon, 1 3/4 cups white sugar, 1 cup vegetable oil, 3 eggs, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 cups shredded carrots, 1 cup flaked coconut, 1 cup chopped walnuts, 1 (8 ounce) can crushed pineapple, drained, 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, 1/4 cup butter, softened, 2 cups confectioners' sugar, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan. 2) Mix flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt and cinnamon. 3) Make a well in the center and add sugar, oil, eggs and vanilla. 4) Mix with wooden spoon until smooth. 5) Stir in carrots, coconut, walnuts and pineapple. 6) Pour into 9x13 inch pan. 7) Bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes. 8) Don't panic, the center will sink a little. 9) Allow to cool. 10) To make the frosting: Cream the butter and cream cheese until smooth. 11) Add the confectioners sugar and beat until creamy.
Question: Sure sounds great. How should I start?
llama_answers: Start by preheating the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 cup butter, softened, 1 cup white sugar, 1/2 cup packed brown sugar, 2 eggs, 3 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1 teaspoon salt, 6 (2.1 ounce) bars chocolate-coated peanut and nougat candy, eg: Baby, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Beat the butter or margarine with the white and brown sugars until light and fluffy. 2) Blend in the eggs, mixing well. 3) Mix in the flour, baking soda and salt to the egg mixture. 4) Reserve 1/2 cup of the chopped candy bars for the topping. 5) Stir the remaining candy into the flour mixture. 6) Spread the batter into one 13x9 inch baking pan. 7) Sprinkle the reserved candy on top. 8) Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 25 to 30 minutes or until lightly browned. 9) Cool in pan on a wire rack then cut into squares.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup white sugar, 1 tablespoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 cup semisweet chocolate chips, 1 egg, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 1/4 cup milk, 1 cup mashed bananas, 
Directions: 0) Measure flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and chocolate chips into a large bowl. 1) Mix thoroughly, and make a well in the center. 2) Beat the egg in a small bowl until frothy. 3) Mix in cooking oil, milk, and bananas. 4) Pour mixture into the well. 5) Stir only to moisten. 6) Fill greased muffin cups 3/4 full. 7) Bake at 400 degrees F (205 degrees C) for 20 to 25 minutes.
Question: Ahah I hope I'll be dead by then! Yes I'd like to prepare the ingredients first! 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour Ok, can I use stevia instead of white sugar?
llama_answers: Please keep in mind that using stevia instead of white sugar may affect the taste and texture of the muffins. Stevia is a natural sweetener that is much sweeter than sugar, so you may need to use less of it to achieve the desired sweetness level. Additionally, stevia can have a bitter aftertaste, so you may need to adjust the recipe accordingly.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 (8.5 ounce) package corn bread/muffin mix, 1 egg, 1/3 cup milk, 2 pounds ground beef, 1/2 cup chopped onion, 1 (26 ounce) jar meatless spaghetti sauce, 1 cup frozen corn, 1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chilies, drained, 2 (1.3 ounce) envelopes sloppy joe mix, 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, 
Directions: 0) Prepare and bake corn bread according to package directions, using the egg and milk. 1) Meanwhile, in a large skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain. 2) Stir in the spaghetti sauce, corn, chilies and sloppy joe mix. 3) Bring to a boil. 4) Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes. 5) Sprinkle with cheese; cover and cook for 1 minute or until cheese is melted. 6) Cut corn bread into six pieces; cut each piece in half. 7) Top with sloppy joe mixture.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 cup sliced almonds, 1/4 cup butter, softened, 2/3 cup white sugar, 1 egg, beaten, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Turn a 9x5 inch loaf pan or metal bowl upside down and cover the outside with foil. 2) Place onto a cookie sheet. 3) Stir together the flour, cocoa, salt and almonds; set aside. 4) In a medium bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until smooth. 5) Beat in the egg and vanilla. 6) Gradually stir in the dry ingredients to form a fairly stiff dough. 7) On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough out to 1/4 inch in thickness. 8) Cut into circles using a glass or cookie cutter. 9) Starting at the top (bottom) of the pan or bowl, arrange cookies so they are overlapping. 10) Work toward the edges covering as much of the pan as you can. 11) Be sure to press each cookie on so you will have a good solid bowl. 12) Bake for 10 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, until cookies are firm. 13) Cool completely. 14) Carefully turn the pan over and remove the pan from the foil, then carefully remove the foil from inside the cookie structure. 15) Fill with cookie or candy.
Question: Ok great. 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour Ok nice, I have them ready. How many ingredients are left?
llama_answers: 8 ingredients left to use.

Ingredients: 8 cups shredded cabbage, 3 medium potatoes, cut into 1/2 inch cubes, 1 medium onion, chopped, 1 3/4 teaspoons salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, 1 (14.5 ounce) can chicken broth, 2 pounds fully cooked kielbasa or Polish sausage, cut into serving size pieces, 
Directions: 0) In a 5-qt. slow cooker, combine the cabbage, potatoes, onion, salt and pepper. 1) Pour broth over all. 2) Place sausage on top (slow cooker will be full, but cabbage will cook down). 3) Cover and cook on low for 8-9 hours or until vegetables are tender and sausage is heated through.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 cup quick cooking oats, 3/4 cup flaked coconut, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1 cup white sugar, 1/2 cup butter, 1 tablespoon golden syrup, 2 tablespoons boiling water, 
Directions: 0) Mix oats, flour, sugar and coconut together. 1) In a small saucepan over low heat, melt the syrup and butter together. 2) Mix the soda and the boiling water and add to the melted butter and syrup. 3) Add butter mixture to the dry ingredients. 4) Drop by teaspoons on greased cookie sheets (or baking paper). 5) Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 18 to 20 minutes.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 6 tablespoons butter or margarine, divided, 1 1/2 pounds halibut steaks, bones removed and cut into 1 inch cubes, 2 garlic cloves, minced, 3/4 teaspoon dried thyme, 1/3 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1 1/2 cups chicken broth, 1 cup heavy whipping cream, 8 ounces lasagna noodles, cooked and drained, 2 cups shredded Swiss cheese, Minced fresh parsley, 
Directions: 0) In a large skillet over medium heat, melt 2 tablespoons butter. 1) Add halibut, garlic and thyme. 2) Cook until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 10 minutes. 3) Remove and set aside. 4) Add the remaining butter to the skillet. 5) Stir in flour and salt until smooth; cook and stir until golden brown. 6) Gradually add broth and cream. 7) Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. 8) In a greased 13-in baking dish, layer half of the noodles, halibut, white sauce and cheese. 9) Repeat layers. 10) Cover and bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes. 11) Uncover; bake 20 minutes longer or until bubbly. 12) Let stand 15 minutes before serving. 13) Sprinkle with parsley if desired.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 6 russet potatoes, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 egg, lightly beaten, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 pinch salt, 
Directions: 0) Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. 1) Drop in potatoes and cook until tender but still firm, about 15 minutes. 2) Drain, cool slightly, and peel. 3) Season with salt, then mash potatoes with fork. 4) Place in large bowl, and stir in egg and olive oil. 5) Knead in enough flour to make a soft dough. 6) On a floured surface, roll dough into a long rope. 7) Cut the rope into 1/2-inch pieces. 8) Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. 9) Drop in gnocchi, and cook until they float to the top, about 3 to 5 minutes. 10) Serve with pasta sauce.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 6 eggs, beaten, 2 1/4 cups milk, 1/3 cup white sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 cup heavy whipping cream, 2 teaspoons white sugar, 1 pinch ground nutmeg, 
Directions: 0) In a large saucepan, combine the eggs, milk and 1/3 cup sugar. 1) Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture coats a metal spoon. 2) Remove from heat. 3) Cool quickly by placing pan in a sink or bowl of ice water and stirring 1 to 2 minutes. 4) Stir in the vanilla. 5) Chill 4 to 24 hours. 6) Before serving, whip the cream and 2 tablespoons sugar until soft peaks form. 7) Transfer chilled egg mixture to a punch bowl. 8) Sprinkle each serving with nutmeg. 9) Fold in whipped cream mixture and serve at once.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 3 egg yolks, separated, 3 eggs whites, separated, 1 cup heavy whipping cream, 
Directions: 0) In a large mixing bowl, combine flour and salt. 1) In a small mixing bowl, beat egg yolks on low while adding cream. 2) Beat for 1 minute. 3) Add to flour mixture; combine on low speed, then beat on medium-high until smooth. 4) In another small mixing bowl and with clean beaters, beat egg whites on high until stiff peaks form. 5) Gently fold into batter. 6) Bake in a preheated waffle iron according to manufacturer's directions. 7) Serve with warm maple syrup or fresh fruit in season.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 1/2 tablespoons olive oil, 3 tablespoons plain yogurt, 2 tablespoons distilled white vinegar, 1 medium onion, sliced, 2 cloves garlic, crushed, 1 tablespoon ginger paste, 2 small green chile peppers, 2 medium tomatoes, chopped, 2 tablespoons garam masala, 1 tablespoon dried mint, salt and pepper to taste, 5 sprigs cilantro, 1 (3 pound) whole chicken, skin removed and cut into pieces, 2 quarts water, 4 cups uncooked basmati rice, 1 bay leaf, 4 pods green cardamom, 1 pod black cardamom, 1 cinnamon stick, salt to taste, 1/4 teaspoon powdered yellow food coloring, 
Directions: 0) Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. 1) Mix in the yogurt and vinegar. 2) Place the onion in the skillet, and cook until tender. 3) Mix in the garlic, ginger paste, green chile peppers, and tomatoes. 4) Cook and stir until tomatoes are tender. 5) Season with garam masala, mint, salt, and pepper, and mix in the cilantro. 6) Place the chicken in the skillet. 7) Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and continue cooking 45 minutes, stirring occasionally, until chicken juices run clear. 8) Bring the water and rice to a boil in a large pot. 9) Mix in the bay leaf, green cardamom, black cardamom, and cinnamon. 10) Season with salt to taste. 11) Cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer 20 minutes. 12) In a separate pot, alternate the rice and chicken mixture in layers, topping with rice. 13) Sprinkle with the food coloring, and mix to serve.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 teaspoons olive oil, 3 tablespoons finely chopped onion, 1 (15.5 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed, 1 (10 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained, 1 tablespoon brown sugar, 1/4 cup salsa, 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes, 2 tablespoons butter, divided, 8 (8 inch) flour tortillas, 1 1/2 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided, 
Directions: 0) Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. 1) Stir in onion, and cook until softened, about 2 minutes. 2) Stir in beans and corn, then add sugar, salsa, and pepper flakes; mix well. 3) Cook until heated through, about 3 minutes. 4) Melt 2 teaspoons of the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. 5) Place a tortilla in the skillet, sprinkle evenly with cheese, then top with some of the bean mixture. 6) Place another tortilla on top, cook until golden, then flip and cook on the other side. 7) Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 pound sliced bacon, cut into thirds, 1 (14 ounce) package beef cocktail wieners, 3/4 cup brown sugar, or to taste, 
Directions: 0) Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). 1) Refrigerate 2/3 of the bacon until needed. 2) Wrap each cocktail wiener with a piece of bacon and secure with a toothpick. 3) Place on a large baking sheet. 4) Sprinkle brown sugar generously over all. 5) Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven, until the sugar is bubbly. 6) To serve, place the wieners in a slow cooker and keep on the low heat.

Directions: 0) In a small bowl, mix together the mustard and onion soup mix. 1) Lay out two long sheets of aluminum foil crosswise. 2) Pat the roast dry, and place in the center of the foil. 3) Generously coat the roast with the mustard mixture. 4) Wrap the foil tightly around the roast, then apply one more piece of foil to really seal it in so that the roast can be rotated without all of the juices spilling out. 5) Prepare an outdoor grill for indirect heat. 6) For charcoal, light the coals, then move to one side of the grill. 7) Place the roast on the grill, and cover. 8) Cook for about 2 hours, turning every 30 to 45 minutes, or until the internal temperature is at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C). 9) Let stand for about 10 minutes before carving. 10) Place on a deep serving plate before unwrapping so you can be sure to save the juices and mustard rub to slather on the beef slices.
Question: I have taken a small bowl, what's next? 0) In a small bowl, mix together the mustard and onion soup mix. Ok. I have added the mustard and onions to the bowl. 1) Lay out two long sheets of aluminum foil crosswise. How long do the sheets need to be or does it not matter?
llama_answers: It doesn't matter, as long as they are long enough to wrap the roast snugly.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups white sugar, 4 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 3/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 egg, 1 cup softened butter or margarine, 1/2 cup sour cream, 
Directions: 0) Combine the flour with the baking powder, baking soda, salt and nutmeg. 1) In a clean 1 liter sized glass jar with a wide mouth layer the white sugar followed by the flour mixture. 2) Press firmly in place and seal. 3) Attach a card with the following instructions: In a large bowl: beat 1 egg with 1 cup softened butter or margarine until light and fluffy. 4) At low speed of an electric mixer add 1/2 cup sour cream, 1 teaspoon vanilla and contents of Jar. 5) Mix until combined. 6) Remove dough from the refrigerator. 7) Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). 8) Roll chilled dough out on a lightly floured surface to 1/8 inch thick. 9) Cut dough into desired shapes. 10) Place on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 10 to 12 minutes.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 cups sugar, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 2 cups chopped dates, 2 cups chopped walnuts or pecans, 4 eggs, lightly beaten, 2 tablespoons butter, melted, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, confectioners' sugar,

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups vegetable oil, 2 cups white sugar, 3 eggs, beaten, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 3 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg, 2 1/2 cups apples - peeled, cored and diced, 1 cup chopped walnuts, 1 cup raisins (optional), 1 (16 ounce) container cream cheese frosting, 1/4 cup finely chopped walnuts,

Ingredients: 1 (12 ounce) package refrigerated biscuit dough, 1 (8 ounce) package corn bread mix, 1 cup diced onion, 1 cup diced celery, 1/2 cup butter, softened, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper, 2 (14.5 ounce) cans chicken broth, 1/8 pound pork sausage, 2 hard-cooked eggs, 1 teaspoon dried sage (optional),

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 3 pounds ground beef, 17 saltine crackers, finely crushed, 1/2 cup milk, 1 1/2 teaspoons garlic powder, 1 1/2 teaspoons onion powder, 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1 pinch salt, or to taste, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, 1 1/2 cups water, 1 (10.75 ounce) can  condensed beef and mushroom soup, 1 (.75 ounce) packet dry brown gravy mix, 
Directions: 0) In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef, saltine crackers and milk. 1) Season with garlic powder, onion powder, salt and pepper, and mix until well blended. 2) Line a 10x15 inch jellyroll pan with waxed paper. 3) Press the beef mixture firmly into the pan. 4) Cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate 8 to 10 hours, or overnight. 5) Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 6) Remove plastic wrap from meat, and rub flour over the top side of the beef. 7) Flip out of the pan onto waxed paper, and rub flour on the other side as well. 8) Cut into pieces (I use a pizza cutter). 9) Heat oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. 10) Fry the meat until browned on each side, turning only once. 11) Remove to a 9x13 inch baking dish. 12) In a medium bowl, mix together the water, condensed soup, and gravy mix. 13) Pour over the meat in the dish. 14) Cover the dish loosely with aluminum foil. 15) Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven. 16) Serve fake steak and gravy with potatoes, rice, or noodles.
Question: Oh! I guess it is vege-food. So could I ask the first two ingredients?
llama_answers: 3 to 5 minutes.

Directions: 0) In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef, saltine crackers and milk. 1) Season with garlic powder, onion powder, salt and pepper, and mix until well blended. 2) Line a 10x15 inch jellyroll pan with waxed paper. 3) Press the beef mixture firmly into the pan. 4) Cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate 8 to 10 hours, or overnight. 5) Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 6) Remove plastic wrap from meat, and rub flour over the top side of the beef. 7) Flip out of the pan onto waxed paper, and rub flour on the other side as well. 8) Cut into pieces (I use a pizza cutter). 9) Heat oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. 10) Fry the meat until browned on each side, turning only once. 11) Remove to a 9x13 inch baking dish. 12) In a medium bowl, mix together the water, condensed soup, and gravy mix. 13) Pour over the meat in the dish. 14) Cover the dish loosely with aluminum foil. 15) Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven. 16) Serve fake steak and gravy with potatoes, rice, or noodles.
Question: Ok I took them! What next? 1/2 cup milk Ok good. I don't have onion powder. Can I use onions. 1/2 cup milk Ok no problem! Are there more ingredients that I should prepare?
llama_answers: No, you have already prepared all the ingredients listed in the recipe.
