Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 teaspoons peanut oil, 2 cloves garlic, thinly sliced, 2 tablespoons grated fresh ginger root, 1/4 cup chopped lemon grass, 2 teaspoons crushed red pepper, 1 teaspoon ground coriander, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into thin strips, 1 onion, thinly sliced, 2 cups bok choy, shredded, 4 cups water, 1 (10 ounce) can coconut milk, 1/4 cup fish sauce, 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro, 
Directions: 0) In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat peanut oil. 1) Stir in garlic, ginger, lemon grass, red pepper, coriander and cumin and cook until fragrant, 2 minutes. 2) Stir in chicken and onion and cook, stirring, until chicken is white and onion is translucent, 5 minutes. 3) Stir in bok choy and cook until it begins to wilt, 5 to 10 minutes. 4) Stir in water, coconut milk, fish sauce and cilantro. 5) Simmer until chicken is thoroughly cooked and flavors are well blended, 30 minutes.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cubed, 1 cup sliced carrots, 1 cup frozen green peas, 1/2 cup sliced celery, 1/3 cup butter, 1/3 cup chopped onion, 1/3 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 1/4 teaspoon celery seed, 1 3/4 cups chicken broth, 2/3 cup milk, 2 (9 inch)  unbaked pie crusts, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). 1) In a saucepan, combine chicken, carrots, peas, and celery. 2) Add water to cover and boil for 15 minutes. 3) Remove from heat, drain and set aside. 4) In the saucepan over medium heat, cook onions in butter until soft and translucent. 5) Stir in flour, salt, pepper, and celery seed. 6) Slowly stir in chicken broth and milk. 7) Simmer over medium-low heat until thick. 8) Remove from heat and set aside. 9) Place the chicken mixture in bottom pie crust. 10) Pour hot liquid mixture over. 11) Cover with top crust, seal edges, and cut away excess dough. 12) Make several small slits in the top to allow steam to escape. 13) Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until pastry is golden brown and filling is bubbly. 14) Cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). 1) In a saucepan, combine chicken, carrots, peas, and celery. 2) Add water to cover and boil for 15 minutes. 3) Remove from heat, drain and set aside. 4) In the saucepan over medium heat, cook onions in butter until soft and translucent. 5) Stir in flour, salt, pepper, and celery seed. 6) Slowly stir in chicken broth and milk. 7) Simmer over medium-low heat until thick. 8) Remove from heat and set aside. 9) Place the chicken mixture in bottom pie crust. 10) Pour hot liquid mixture over. 11) Cover with top crust, seal edges, and cut away excess dough. 12) Make several small slits in the top to allow steam to escape. 13) Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until pastry is golden brown and filling is bubbly. 14) Cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 pound cubed beef stew meat, 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 teaspoons butter, 1 medium yellow onion, thinly sliced, 1/4 cup red wine, 1 beef bouillon cube, 1 cup hot water, 1 large potato, cubed, 1/2 cup baby carrots, 1/2 teaspoon rosemary, 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme, 1/2 tablespoon garlic powder, 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1/4 cup water, 2 dashes Worcestershire sauce, 
Directions: 0) Place cubed beef and flour in a resealable plastic bag. 1) Seal and shake to evenly coat beef with flour. 2) Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat, and brown beef on all sides. 3) Transfer to a slow cooker. 4) Melt the butter in the skillet over medium heat, and cook onion until tender. 5) Transfer to the slow cooker with the beef. 6) Pour wine into the skillet to deglaze, then pour wine into slow cooker. 7) Dissolve the beef bouillon cube in 1 cup hot water, and pour into slow cooker. 8) Place potato and carrots in slow cooker, and season with rosemary, thyme, garlic powder, and pepper. 9) Mix in remaining water and Worcestershire sauce. 10) Add more water if needed to cover all ingredients. 11) Cover slow cooker, and cook stew 7 to 8 hours on low heat.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 tablespoon butter, unsalted, 2 cups Broccoflower, diced, 2 cups assorted wild mushrooms, chopped, 1/2 white onion, chopped, 2 tablespoons garlic, minced, 3 cups Arborio rice, 9 cups chicken stock, unsalted, 1 pinch fresh ground nutmeg, 1/4 cup fresh herbs; tarragon, parsley, chives, diced, 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese, Salt and pepper to taste, 
Directions: 0) Melt butter and saute Broccoflower, mushrooms, onions and garlic for 10 minutes. 1) Remove sauteed ingredients and place aside. 2) In same pan, cook the rice by adding chicken stock one-cup at a time stirring until well incorporated before adding the next cup. 3) Once chicken stock is absorbed and rice is tender, stir in nutmeg, herbs and season with salt and pepper. 4) Once rice risotto is cooked, stir in the sauteed ingredients, salt and pepper to taste. 5) Stir in Parmesan cheese before serving.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 3 cups crushed vanilla wafers, 1/2 cup chopped pecans, 2/3 cup butter, melted, 2 cups semisweet chocolate chips, 4 cups milk, 4 1/2 cups miniature marshmallows, 2 (3.5 ounce) packages instant vanilla pudding mix, 1 cup frozen whipped topping, thawed, 2 large bananas, sliced, 1 (1.5 ounce) bar milk chocolate candy, 
Directions: 0) Combine crushed cookie crumbs, pecans, and butter or margarine. 1) Press into a 9 x 13 inch pan. 2) Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 5 minutes. 3) Cool. 4) Combine chocolate chips, 1 cup milk, and 2 cups marshmallows in a sauce pan. 5) Stir over low heat until melted. 6) Pour over cooled crust. 7) Chill for 1 hour. 8) Arrange banana slices over chilled chocolate layer. 9) Prepare pudding mix as directed on box except use only 3 cups of milk. 10) Fold in nondairy whipped topping and remaining marshmallows. 11) Pour pudding mixture over bananas. 12) Grate chocolate bar over the top. 13) Chill for 2 to 3 hours before serving.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 4 pounds dark meat chicken pieces, 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, 5 cloves crushed garlic, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon poultry seasoning, 3 (4 ounce) links sweet Italian sausage, sliced, 1 cup chopped onion, 3 carrots, sliced, 1/2 pound fresh mushrooms, sliced, 1/2 teaspoon dried rosemary, 1 cup red wine, 1 (14.5 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes, salt and pepper to taste, 
Directions: 0) In a large skillet, heat oil. 1) Add 1/2 of the garlic. 2) Season flour with poultry seasoning. 3) Dredge chicken parts in flour, then brown in the skillet for 4 or 5 minutes. 4) Add the sausage, and saute for a few minutes. 5) Add the onion, carrots, mushrooms, rosemary and the remaining garlic. 6) Stir all together. 7) Add the wine and tomatoes; stir. 8) Cover and let simmer over low heat for 25 minutes. 9) Season with salt and pepper to taste and let simmer for another 10 minutes. 10) Let cool covered for 10 minutes, then serve.

Ingredients: 4 pounds dark meat chicken pieces, 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, 5 cloves crushed garlic, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon poultry seasoning, 3 (4 ounce) links sweet Italian sausage, sliced, 1 cup chopped onion, 3 carrots, sliced, 1/2 pound fresh mushrooms, sliced, 1/2 teaspoon dried rosemary, 1 cup red wine, 1 (14.5 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes, salt and pepper to taste, 
Directions: 0) In a large skillet, heat oil. 1) Add 1/2 of the garlic. 2) Season flour with poultry seasoning. 3) Dredge chicken parts in flour, then brown in the skillet for 4 or 5 minutes. 4) Add the sausage, and saute for a few minutes. 5) Add the onion, carrots, mushrooms, rosemary and the remaining garlic. 6) Stir all together. 7) Add the wine and tomatoes; stir. 8) Cover and let simmer over low heat for 25 minutes. 9) Season with salt and pepper to taste and let simmer for another 10 minutes. 10) Let cool covered for 10 minutes, then serve.
Question: Ok can I also use fresh rosemary instead? 1/2 pound fresh mushrooms, sliced Ok thanks, what is next? 1 cup red wine Ok how big should the can be?
llama_answers: The can of red wine should be 14.5 ounces.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 8 medium beets, 1 pound unsalted butter, 1 1/2 cups minced Vidalia onions, 4 Bosc pears - peeled, cored and minced, 2 tablespoons white sugar, 1/2 cup cranberry vinegar, 1 teaspoon salt, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). 1) Wash beets, and place in a roasting pan. 2) Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until tender. Set aside to cool. 3) Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. 4) Stir in onion, pears, sugar, and vinegar; cook, stirring frequently, for 20 minutes. 5) When the beets are cool enough to handle, peel and coursely chop. 6) Puree onion mixture in a food processor with metal blade. 7) Add salt and 1/2 of the beets; pulse 4 to 5 times. 8) Add remaining beets, and pulse 2 to 3 times.
Question: Ok. I have done that. What is next? 1) Wash beets, and place in a roasting pan. Ok. what should I do with it? 2) Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until tender. Set aside to cool. Ok. when do I know when they are ready?
llama_answers: When the beets are tender and can be easily pierced with a fork.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 medium onion, chopped, 1 green bell pepper, chopped, 1 large carrot, peeled and thinly sliced, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, 1 (14 ounce) can chicken broth, 2 cups cubed cooked ham, 1/4 teaspoon cumin, 1/2 teaspoon salt, ground black pepper to taste, 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, 1 cup sour cream, 
Directions: 0) Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. 1) Stir in the onion, bell pepper, carrot, and garlic, and cook 5 minutes, until tender. 2) Mix in 1 can black beans and chicken broth. 3) In a blender, puree remaining can of beans until smooth. 4) Mix into the pot. 5) Bring soup to a boil. 6) Reduce heat to low. 7) Mix in ham, cumin, salt, and pepper. 8) Simmer 20 minutes. 9) Garnish with Cheddar cheese and sour cream to serve.
Question: Yes that would be good! 2 tablespoons vegetable oil Ok they are ready! What next?
llama_answers: Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 cup butter, softened, 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 1/2 cups semisweet chocolate chips, 4 teaspoons shortening, 3/4 cup ground walnuts, 
Directions: 0) In a mixing bowl, cream butter and confectioners' sugar. 1) Add vanilla. 2) Gradually add flour; mix well. 3) With lightly floured hands, shape tablespoonfuls of batter into cookies. 4) Place cookies apart on ungreased baking sheets. 5) Bake at 350 degrees F for 9-11 minutes or until edges and bottom are lightly browned. 6) Cool for 2-3 minutes before removing to wire racks. 7) In a microwave-safe bowl, melt chocolate chips and shortening; stir until smooth. 8) Drizzle chocolate over half of the cookies. 9) Dip one end of remaining cookies into chocolate, then sprinkle with walnuts.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 cup white sugar, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 cup buttermilk, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 2 eggs, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 2 tablespoons white sugar, 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 2 teaspoons margarine, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Grease one 9x5 inch loaf pan. 2) Measure flour, 1 cup sugar, baking powder, baking soda, 1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon, salt, buttermilk, oil, eggs and vanilla into large mixing bowl. 3) Beat 3 minutes. 4) Pour into prepared loaf pan. 5) Smooth top. 6) Combine 2 tablespoons white sugar, 1 teaspoon cinnamon and butter, mixing until crumbly. 7) Sprinkle topping over smoothed batter. 8) Using knife, cut in a light swirling motion to give a marbled effect. 9) Bake for about 50 minutes. 10) Test with toothpick. 11) When inserted it should come out clean. 12) Remove bread from pan to rack to cool.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, 1 cup milk, 1 cup dry bread crumbs, 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley, 1 cup olive oil, 1 orange, sliced into rounds, 1 cup dry white wine, 1/2 cup orange juice, 1 (10.5 ounce) can chicken broth, 1/4 cup brandy-based orange liqueur (Grand Marnier), 
Directions: 0) Slice chicken breasts in thirds horizontally to make 12 thin chicken fillets. 1) Lightly pound each piece. 2) Place in a dish, and pour milk over them. 3) Soak for 10 minutes. 4) In a shallow bowl, stir together the bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese and parsley. 5) Set aside. 6) Heat olive oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. 7) Dredge chicken pieces in the bread crumb mixture, and place in the hot oil. 8) Quickly brown on both sides, then remove to a buttered 9x13 inch baking dish, or similar size. 9) Season with salt and pepper to taste. 10) Place orange slices over the top of the chicken. 11) Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 12) Drain the oil from the skillet, reserving 1/4 cup. 13) Heat the reserved oil with the wine over medium heat until reduced by 1/2. 14) Add broth and orange juice, and reduce by 1/2 again. 15) Pour the sauce over the chicken, then drizzle with Grand Marinier. 16) Bake for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven, until bubbly.
Question: Yes please. 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves Ok I will do that. Can I also use almond milk instead?
llama_answers: No, the recipe calls for regular milk.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 3/4 cup shortening, 1 cup sugar, 1 egg, 1/4 cup molasses, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 teaspoons baking soda, 1 1/2 teaspoons ground ginger, 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon salt, Additional sugar, 
Directions: 0) In a large mixing bowl, cream the shortening and sugar. 1) Beat in the egg and molasses. 2) Combine flour, baking soda, ginger, cinnamon and salt; gradually add to creamed mixture. 3) Roll teaspoonfuls of dough into balls. 4) Dip one side of each ball into sugar; place with sugar side up on a greased baking sheet. 5) Bake at 350 degrees F for 12-15 minutes or until lightly browned and crinkly.
Question: Hm that sounds perfect. 3/4 cup shortening Ok. Should the sugar be white or brown? 3/4 cup shortening Ok no problem. What are the next ingredients?

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 cups sugar, 1 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1 cup water, 1/2 cup vegetable oil, 1/2 cup butter or margarine, 1/4 cup baking cocoa, 2 eggs, 1/2 cup buttermilk, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 cup butter or margarine, 1/3 cup whipping cream, 1/4 cup baking cocoa, 1 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon, 3 cups confectioners' sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 cup finely chopped walnuts, 
Directions: 0) In a mixing bowl, combine the first four ingredients. 1) In a saucepan, combine water, oil, butter and cocoa; bring to a boil over medium heat. 2) pour over dry ingredients; mix well. 3) Add eggs, buttermilk, vanilla and baking soda; mix well. 4) Pour into a greased and floured 15-in pan. 5) Bake at 375 degrees F for 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. 6) Meanwhile, for frosting, combine the butter, cream, cocoa and cinnamon in a saucepan. 7) Cook and stir over medium heat until butter is melted and mixture is heated through. 8) Remove from the heat; beat in sugar and vanilla until smooth. 9) Stir in walnuts. 10) Carefully spread over hot cake. 11) Cool completely.

llama_answers: It's a liquid ingredient that will help the cake come together.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1/4 cup sifted all-purpose flour, 1/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1 pinch salt, 2 ounces butter, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1/4 cup white sugar, 1 egg, 2 egg yolks, 1/3 cup confectioners' sugar for decoration, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). 1) Butter one Madeleine pan. 2) Sift the flour, cocoa, baking powder and salt together. 3) Cream the butter with the vanilla and the sugar. 4) Add the egg and egg yolks, beating to mix. 5) Stir in the dry ingredients until just combined only, do not over mix. 6) Place rounded teaspoon of batter into the prepared Madeleine shell forms. 7) Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 12 minutes. 8) Remove from oven and immediately invert onto a wire rack to cool. 9) Once cool sprinkle with confectioners' sugar, if desired.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups boiling chicken broth, 1/2 cup uncooked long grain rice, 1/4 teaspoon Italian seasoning, 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped broccoli, thawed and drained, 1 tablespoon grated Parmesan cheese, 1 (2.8 ounce) can French-fried onions, divided, 1 pound fresh or frozen fish fillets, thawed, 1 dash paprika, 1/2 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, 
Directions: 0) In a greased 11-in. baking dish, combine the broth, rice, Italian seasoning and garlic powder. 1) Cover and bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 10 minutes. 2) Add the broccoli, Parmesan cheese and half of the onions. 3) Top with fish fillets; sprinkle with paprika. 4) Cover and bake 20-25 minutes longer or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. 5) Uncover; sprinkle with cheddar cheese and remaining onions. 6) Return to the oven for 3 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Directions: 0) In a greased 11-in. baking dish, combine the broth, rice, Italian seasoning and garlic powder. 1) Cover and bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 10 minutes. 2) Add the broccoli, Parmesan cheese and half of the onions. 3) Top with fish fillets; sprinkle with paprika. 4) Cover and bake 20-25 minutes longer or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. 5) Uncover; sprinkle with cheddar cheese and remaining onions. 6) Return to the oven for 3 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 pound chicken parts, 1 large onion, 3 stalks celery, including some leaves, 1 large carrot, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, 3 whole cloves, 6 cups water, 1/4 cup cold water (optional), 1 egg, 
Directions: 0) Quarter onion. 1) Chop scrubbed celery and carrot into 1 inch chunks. 2) Place chicken pieces, onion, celery, carrot, salt, and cloves in large soup pot or Dutch oven. 3) Add 6 cups water. 4) Bring to a boil. 5) Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 1 hour. 6) Remove chicken and vegetables. 7) Strain stock. 8) Skim fat off the surface. 9) Separate the egg white from the egg yolk, and reserve the shell. 10) In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup cold water, egg white, and crushed eggshell. 11) Add to strained stock, and bring to a boil. 12) Remove from heat, and let stand 5 minutes. 13) Strain again through a sieve lined with cheesecloth.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 (4 ounce) bar German sweet chocolate, chopped, 1/3 cup milk, 4 ounces cream cheese, softened, 2 tablespoons white sugar, 1 (12 ounce) container frozen whipped topping, thawed, 1 (9 inch) prepared graham cracker crust, 
Directions: 0) Microwave chocolate and 2 tablespoons of the milk in large microwave-safe bowl on high 1 1/2 to 2 minutes or until chocolate is almost melted, stirring halfway through heating time. 1) Beat in cream cheese, sugar, and remaining milk with wire whisk until blended. 2) Refrigerate 10 minutes. 3) Gently fold in 3 1/2 cups of the whipped topping until no streaks remain. 4) Spoon into crust. 5) Freeze pie 4 hours. 6) Before cutting pie, let stand at room temperature 15 minutes. 7) Serve with remaining whipped topping.

Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F ( 175 degrees C). 1) Lightly grease a 9 inch springform pan. 2) In a small bowl, mix together 1 1/2 cups chocolate wafer crumbs, 2 tablespoons sugar, and melted butter. 3) Press onto the bottom and 1 1/2 inch up the sides of the prepared 9 inch springform pan. 4) Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 10 minutes. 5) Allow to cool. 6) Reduce oven temperature to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). 7) To Make Filling: In a small saucepan, heat 1/4 cup whipping cream and 1/4 cup chocolate chips, stirring constantly, until chips are melted. 8) In a large mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and 1 cup of sugar until smooth. 9) Add cocoa and beat well. 10) Add eggs and beat on low until just blended. 11) Stir in 1 teaspoon vanilla and reserved chocolate mixture until blended. 12) Pour over crust. 13) Bake at 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) for 45 to 50 minutes or until center is almost set. 14) To Make Topping: In a small saucepan, heat 1/4 cup whipping cream and 1 teaspoon vanilla until just before boiling. 15) Stir constantly and be careful not to boil over. 16) Have 1 1/2 cups chocolate chips ready in a small bowl. 17) Pour in the hot cream and stir with a spoon until smooth. 18) Spread over baked cheesecake and refrigerate overnight.
Question: Ok good plan. 1 1/2 cups chocolate cookie crumbs Ok nice I have all the ingredients ready. What are the next ingredients?
llama_answers: chocolate cookie crumbs.
